intro: Boucerosia acutangula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock fig, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, narrow leaves that are often covered in a whitish powdery coating. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by edible fig-like fruits. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and succulent collections.
